content.question: A computer company wants to hire a large group of employees to work in a newly opened branch of the company. The human resources department determines that the most effective way to screen applicants would be the use of intelligence testing. Which of the following is the main reason that the implementation of this screening policy would be inappropriate?

choices.label: Intelligence tests can be subject to bias.
Intelligence testing can be expensive and time consuming.
Intelligence tests are only used to identify students who require educational services.
Intelligence testing can be too complex to be useful.

content.answer: Intelligence tests can be subject to bias.

skill.text: 1.B: Explain how cultural norms, expectations, and circumstances, as well as cognitive biases apply to behavior and mental processes.
